passage_text: You should expect to pay more for high quality service. 1  Basic car detailing service should include a wash, wax, interior vacuuming, interior polish, window wash, mirror and trim cleaning and tire cleaning. 2  You can expect to pay $50 to $125 for an average sized vehicle and $75 to $150 for an SUV or van. 1 An upgraded package usually consists of much more attention to detail. 2  These details will vary by location so be sure to inquire about exactly what services you'll be getting for your money. 3  Upgrades generally cost $150 and up for regular sized vehicles and $175 and up for larger trucks and vans.

1 For example, CostHelper readers report paying $155-$160 for a mid-range detailing, at an average cost of $136; Shine & Style Mobile Detail in Raleigh, NC, offers a Full Detail Econo Package (3.5-4.5 hours) for $195 for a car or $245 for an SUV or van. 1 A car wax buffer can cost $30-$120 or more, and Jorgen's Shine Shop offers DIY kits for $33-$250. 2  Auto detailing services are typically offered at car washes, specialty stores and auto body repair shops, or by mobile companies using specialized trailers.

The price range for this type of service starts at $85 for a car or Jeep Wrangler. The starting services include hand car wash and wax, leather conditioning and floor-mat shampoo. As you add more services, the price increases to $210 for a car or Jeep Wrangler. Larger vehicles can cost from $20 to $80 more.

1 Basic car detailing service should include a wash, wax, interior vacuuming, interior polish, window wash, mirror and trim cleaning and tire cleaning. 2  You can expect to pay $50 to $125 for an average sized vehicle and $75 to $150 for an SUV or van. 3  An upgraded package usually consists of much more attention to detail. 1 An upgraded package usually consists of much more attention to detail. 2  These details will vary by location so be sure to inquire about exactly what services you'll be getting for your money. 3  Upgrades generally cost $150 and up for regular sized vehicles and $175 and up for larger trucks and vans.

1 CostHelper readers report paying $150-$300 for a complete auto detailing, at an average cost of $233. 2  Shine & Style Mobile Detail in Raleigh, NC, has an Ultimate Detail package for $375 for a car or $475 for an SUV or van. 1 A car wax buffer can cost $30-$120 or more, and Jorgen's Shine Shop offers DIY kits for $33-$250. 2  Auto detailing services are typically offered at car washes, specialty stores and auto body repair shops, or by mobile companies using specialized trailers.

Extra Costs. Additional car detailing services will increase the cost of the service. A premium wax service can range from $60 to $90. Steam cleaning costs start around $85 and runs up to $130. If you have a leather interior, you will need a premium upholstery cleaning service, which ranges from $50 to $75. Basic Car Detail Costs. On average, basic car detailing services range from $60 to $90, depending on the size of the vehicle. Premium services range from $150 to $190.

1 For example, CostHelper readers report paying $40-$90 for a basic wash and wax, at an average cost of $72; Mobile Works Auto Detailing in Chambersburg, PA, has a wash-wax-vacuum package for $75 for a car, $100 for a mid-size truck or SUV, $125 for a full-size truck or SUV, and $150 for a full-size van or large SUV. 1 A car wax buffer can cost $30-$120 or more, and Jorgen's Shine Shop offers DIY kits for $33-$250. 2  Auto detailing services are typically offered at car washes, specialty stores and auto body repair shops, or by mobile companies using specialized trailers.

1 CarsDirect.com offers Do-it-yourself detailing tips. 2  Basic supplies like buckets, cleaners and wax can cost $5-$100 or more, depending on what is needed. 3  A car wax buffer can cost $30-$120 or more, and Jorgen's Shine Shop offers DIY kits for $33-$250. 1 A car wax buffer can cost $30-$120 or more, and Jorgen's Shine Shop offers DIY kits for $33-$250. 2  Auto detailing services are typically offered at car washes, specialty stores and auto body repair shops, or by mobile companies using specialized trailers.
